metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2121 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
OFFIS DCMTK's (All versions prior to 3.6.7) has a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability while processing DICOM files, which may result in a denial-of-service condition.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dcmtk - 3.6.4-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libdcmtk14 - 3.6.4-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dcmtk package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.4-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
